detaileddescription.para: Error threshold for determining how close a point needs to be to a surface to be considered on it
A general plane perpendicular to the 2D xy plane
A circle with axis parallel to the z-axis
A plane perpendicular to the x-axis
A plane perpendicular to the y-axis
A plane perpendicular to the z-axis

briefdescription.para: The types of surfaces supported by OpenMOC.

detaileddescription.para: No boundary type (typically an interface between flat source regions)

briefdescription.para: The types of boundary conditions supported by OpenMOC for surfaces.
Returns an auto-generated unique surface ID.

detaileddescription.para: This method is intended as a utility mehtod for user's writing OpenMOC input files. The method makes use of a static surface ID which is incremented each time the method is called to enable unique generation of monotonically increasing IDs. The method's first ID begins at 10000. Hence, user-defined surface IDs greater than or equal to 10000 is prohibited.

The Surface class and subclasses.
